description: From Spanish cuerda (“cord”), or Mexican Spanish cuarta (“whip”).

entries.meaning: A rawhide whip plaited with two thongs of buffalo hide.
examples: He sprang into the saddle easily as a bird, got the quirt from the horn, and gave his pony a slash with it.

verbs.description: quirt (third-person singular simple present quirts, present participle quirting, simple past and past participle quirted)
